alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 12:28PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm cluster will impact areas from Munds Park to near Mormon Lake through 100 PM MST... At 1226 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm cluster from Munds Park to near Mormon Lake. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, heavy rainfall and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mormon Lake, Munds Park, Dairy Springs Campground, Double Springs Campground, Pinegrove Campground and Ashurst Lake Campgrounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 312 and 326. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. If on or near Mormon Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
